definition: (so as) to avoid/to prevent/(just) in case
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent
to guard against the unexpected (idiom); just in case/prepared for any eventualities
frugality in order to prevent destitution (idiom)

sentences.english: I have kept a reserve fund in case of accidents.
sentences.chinese: 我已籌備了一筆準備基金以防不測。

sentences.english: You should constantly monitor the cost of development and check for cost overrun.
sentences.chinese: 應該不斷地監視開發的成本以防成本超出預算。

sentences.english: Raj :Oh, we should have a plan in case one of us gets lucky.
sentences.chinese: 噢，我們得制定個計劃以防萬一我們中有誰走桃花運。

sentences.english: Wood or glass-fiber spacers are used to prevent the electrodes form touching.
sentences.chinese: 電極襯有木頭或玻璃纖維以防電極腐蝕。

sentences.english: One day I was going to my auntie's home, mom told me to bring an umbrella in case it mined.
sentences.chinese: 一天我去姑姑家，媽媽叮囑我帶把傘以防下雨。

sentences.english: But she kept overfeeding her cat just in case.
sentences.chinese: 但是她一直過量地喂着她的貓，以防萬一。

sentences.english: These were extra wedges in case they should be needed.
sentences.chinese: 這些額外的木楔是以防萬一的。

sentences.english: Acquire for this need additional backup disk drive, in case the discharge outside data.
sentences.chinese: 爲此需要添置額外備份磁碟機，以防數據外泄。

sentences.english: The burglars wore rubber gloves to guard against fingerprints.
sentences.chinese: 盜賊戴著橡皮手套以防留下指紋印。

sentences.english: We're supposed to be a pair of likely lads, just in case the slave-catchers are watching.
sentences.chinese: 我們要裝作是一對小男孩，以防努力獵手看見。

sentences.english: They hid themselves behind some bushed for fear that the enemy should find them.
sentences.chinese: 他們躲在灌木叢後面，以防敵人會發現他們。

sentences.english: Bulletproof helmets are widely used to prevent bullets and fragments.
sentences.chinese: 防彈頭盔通常用以防子彈或破片。

sentences.english: And install clutch safe-device to prevent the damage.
sentences.chinese: 並設有離合安全裝置，以防超負荷引起的機器損傷。

sentences.english: Certainly must have the guarantee regarding the strong point practice, by against is out of practice.
sentences.chinese: 當然對於強項的練習也要有所保證，以防手生。

sentences.english: Keep your exchange vouchers as you may need to show them when you are leaving the country.
sentences.chinese: 保留水單，以防離開這個國家時還用得着。

sentences.english: He taped a nail in slowly to spilt the thin board.
sentences.chinese: 他慢慢地把釘子釘進這塊簿板，以防劈開。

definition: in order to avoid/so as not to
to prevent/to guard against/to take precautions
to avert/to prevent/to avoid/to refrain from
to guard against/to beware of
remember at all costs
to take note of/to pay attention to
by no means
to be careful/to take care
must/to need to/to be sure to
to avoid as taboo/to avoid by all means
best/(you) had better (do what we suggest)
to take strict precautions/on your guard
as much as possible/to the greatest extent
to guard against the unexpected (idiom); just in case/prepared for any eventualities
to take care/to look out
not suitable/inadvisable/inappropriate
